IN THEIR OWN RIGHT.Definition: because of their own special qualities

BATTERED.Definition: damaged by age and repeated use

SHINY.Definition: made even or smooth and bright by use or rubbing

SPACIOUS.Definition: large, with a lot of space

RECTORY.Definition: the house provided to a priest

BOARDING SCHOOL.Definition: a school in which students lived and studied

STIMULATION.Definition: a cause to be interested or engaged in something

PROSE.Definition: ordinary form of written language rather than poetry

STIMULATING.Definition: encouraging or causing interest or enthusiasm

CULTURED.Definition: characterised by good taste and manners and good education

LITERARY.Definition: relating to written works of art

ALLIES.Definition: countries that had officially agreed to help each other during the war

SEIZED ON.Definition: took advantage of it right away

ISOLATED.Definition: far away from people or events

THOUGHT-PROVOKING.Definition: causing people to think seriously about something

INCIDENTALLY.Definition: by the way, speaking of which

ADEQUATELY.Definition: in a way that is enough

FUNDAMENTALLY.Definition: in a way that is basic or very important

STYLISTICALLY.Definition: in a way that relates to the style in which her works are written

GEEKS.Definition: people with knowledge about and interest in it

EPISTOLARY.Definition: literary works in the form of letters

NARRATOR.Definition: the character who tells what is happening in a book

FAIRYTALE.Definition: traditional story about magical and imaginary beings and lands

DRAMATISED.Definition: put in a suitable for a book form

CONVEY.Definition: express, make them known and understandable

SUBTLETIES.Definition: qualities and details that are difficult to find and describe

CRITICS.Definition: people who expressed not favourable opinions about her

SUPERFICIAL.Definition: concerned with only what is obvious, not deep

FENCED.Definition: surrounded with a protective barrier, enclosed

CULTIVATED.Definition: providing lots of plants and flowers

BORDERS.Definition: barriers that prevent communication with the outer world, boundaries

SKULL.Definition: the bones of the head surrounding the brain

SHIN-BONE.Definition: the bone from the front of the leg below the knee

CLUE.Definition: a useful sign or piece of information

CRITICISM.Definition: expressions of not favourable opinions about her

SUITABLY.Definition: in a right or appropriate way

ADAPTATIONS.Definition: works that have been remade into a new form

SPIN-OFFS.Definition: new productions based on her works

BRIDE.Definition: a woman who is about to get or just got married

ADAPTATION.Definition: a work that has been remade into a new form

REINTERPRETED.Definition: understood again in a new way

HEROINE.Definition: the main female character in the book

OBSTINATE.Definition: very difficult to change, stubborn, strong-minded

HEADSTRONG.Definition: not having patience and easily annoyed, stubborn

DETERMINED.Definition: having made a strong decision and not wanting to change it

IMPATIENT.Definition: not having patience and easily annoyed

INSULT.Definition: expression of not showing respect, offensive comment

SUBMISSIVE.Definition: ready to do what others ask

SLUR.Definition: expression of not showing respect, offensive comment
